head.citation-title: Remarks on Adaptive-Type Direct Controller Using Recurrent Quaternion Neural Network
head.abstracts: © 2018 IEEE.In this study, a fully connected recurrent neural network is applied to controlling non-linear systems, where all the network parameters and signals are expressed in quaternion numbers, and its training is conducted using a real-time recurrent learning algorithm. To match the outputs of the non-linear system with the desired outputs, the recurrent quaternion neural network (RQNN) assumes the role of an adaptive-type servo controller. Numerical simulations for controlling the discrete-time non-linear multiple-input and multiple-output plant are conducted to evaluate the characteristics of the RQNN-based adaptive-type direct controller. The simulation results exhibit the feasibility and effectiveness of the proposed controller.
